title: Steeley
author: Steeley
content: Here is a link to an article about the Lite coin halving. Bobby and Charlie Lee are featured: https://www.coindesk.com/tech/2023/07/31/as-litecoin-halving-approaches-founder-touts-silver-collector-cards-loaded-with-digital-silver/Here is an element of particular interest here in this forum: PCGS Slabbed Ballet Card - Genuine, no grade

comments.author: rsincognito
comments.body: Wasn‚Äôt someone selling these on here ? I‚Äôm interested. Ty

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: coblee had one for sale - he posted it on here a while back.coblee will also have approx 500 more for the current halving 6.25 LTC he said the wallets will cost approx 1000 USD

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: Steeley on August 02, 2023, 05:35:33 PMHere is a link to an article about the Lite coin halving. Bobby and Charlie Lee are featured: https://www.coindesk.com/tech/2023/07/31/as-litecoin-halving-approaches-founder-touts-silver-collector-cards-loaded-with-digital-silver/Here is an element of particular interest here in this forum: PCGS Slabbed Ballet Card - Genuine, no gradeFor reference, this was the 50g silver Ballet Litecoin card from the last halving in 2019It contains 12.5 LTC and there were 300 made

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on August 02, 2023, 06:09:52 PMcoblee had one for sale - he posted it on here a while back.coblee will also have approx 500 more for the current halving 6.25 LTC he said the wallets will cost approx 1000 USDLove these "fresh" coin collectibles. Do you have any info as to when these will be released? @Mopar?Slightly OT, but is there a list of Bitcoin collectibles that was funded directly from a block reward?

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: Kryptowerk on August 02, 2023, 07:10:30 PMQuote from: MoparMiningLLC on August 02, 2023, 06:09:52 PMcoblee had one for sale - he posted it on here a while back.coblee will also have approx 500 more for the current halving 6.25 LTC he said the wallets will cost approx 1000 USDLove these "fresh" coin collectibles. Do you have any info as to when these will be released? @Mopar?Slightly OT, but is there a list of Bitcoin collectibles that was funded directly from a block reward?Without thinking about it too much, BTCC are the only ones I know ....Bitcoin 2020 Chips were funded directly from BTCC items, so are only "1 hop virgins"And then the Fresh LTC coins were funded directly from block rewards

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: I wonder if they will grade my cold key cards. üòÇüòÇüòÇüòÇOkay bad joke sorry, but still it kind of sets a new precedent for them doesn't it?

comments.author: tread93
comments.body: Wow that looks amazing, do we have the exact dimensions of this Slab? Props to Bobby and Charlie on this huge honor for having their product now being graded by one of the top grading companies üëè

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Quote from: Kryptowerk on August 02, 2023, 07:10:30 PMQuote from: MoparMiningLLC on August 02, 2023, 06:09:52 PMcoblee had one for sale - he posted it on here a while back.coblee will also have approx 500 more for the current halving 6.25 LTC he said the wallets will cost approx 1000 USDLove these "fresh" coin collectibles. Do you have any info as to when these will be released? @Mopar?Slightly OT, but is there a list of Bitcoin collectibles that was funded directly from a block reward?Charlie did not give any specific date - he said they should all be funded before the end of august - Litecoinpool.org is going to fund them directly with block rewards - they have 500 to do. He also said he was having them all slabbed by PCGS. He did not specify a for sure sale date - mentioned possibility of an auction for the numbers and something about possibly selling them on the cruise that is in October to celebrate Litecoins birthday.
